00027 
00028 void Ecoulomb::Initialize(QMTopology *top, Property *options) {
00029     _options = options;
00030     if (options->exists("options.ecoulomb.method")) {
00031         if (options->get("options.ecoulomb.method").as<string > () == "distdep") {
00032                if (options->exists("options.ecoulomb.cutoff")) {
00033             _ecoulomb_cutoff = options->get("options.ecoulomb.cutoff").as<double>();
00034             _has_cutoff=true;
00035             cout << "Using a cutoff for distance-dependent screening of " << _ecoulomb_cutoff << " nm" << endl;
00036         } else {
00037             cout << "Warning: no cutoff defined, using the whole box" << endl;
00038              _has_cutoff=false;
00039                 }
00040             if (options->exists("options.ecoulomb.epsilon")) {
00041                 _epsilon_dielectric = options->get("options.ecoulomb.epsilon").as<double>();
00042             } else {
00043                 //_epsilon_dielectric = 3.0;
00044                throw std::runtime_error("Error in ecoulomb: dielectric constant is not provided");
00045             }
00046             if (options->exists("options.ecoulomb.screening")) {
00047                 _s_eps = options->get("options.ecoulomb.screening").as<double>();
00048             } else {
00049                 //_s_eps = 3.0;
00050                throw std::runtime_error("Error in ecoulomb: screening length is not provided.");
00051             }
00052             cout << "Doing distance-dependent screening with bulk relative dielectric constant " << _epsilon_dielectric << " and screening " << _s_eps <<" nm^-1" << endl;
00053             _estatic_method = &Ecoulomb::dist_dep_eps;
00054         }
00055 
00056         else if (options->get("options.ecoulomb.method").as<string > () == "simple") {
00057 
00058              if (options->exists("options.ecoulomb.cutoff")) {
00059             _ecoulomb_cutoff = options->get("options.ecoulomb.cutoff").as<double>();
00060             _has_cutoff=true;
00061             cout << "Using a cutoff for simple estatic of " << _ecoulomb_cutoff << " nm" << endl;
00062         } else {
00063             cout << "Warning: no cutoff defined, using the whole box" << endl;
00064              _has_cutoff=false;
00065                 }
00066 
00067              if (options->exists("options.ecoulomb.epsilon")) {             
00068                  _epsilon_dielectric = options->get("options.ecoulomb.epsilon").as<double>();
00069              } else {
00070                   //_epsilon_dielectric = 3.0;
00071                 throw  std::runtime_error("Error in ecoulomb: relative dielectric constant is not provided.");
00072              }
00073              cout << "Doing simple estatic with constant relative dielectric constant of = " << _epsilon_dielectric << endl;
00074              _estatic_method = &Ecoulomb::constant_epsilon;
00075         }
00076 
00077         else throw std::runtime_error("Error in ecoulomb: the method (simple or distdep) is not specified.");
00078     } else throw std::runtime_error("Error in ecoulomb: the method (simple or distdep) is not specified.");
00079 }
00080 
00081 bool Ecoulomb::EvaluateFrame(QMTopology *top) {
00082     vector<QMCrgUnit *> lcharges = top->CrgUnits();
00083     Topology atop;
00084     atop.setBox(top->getBox());
00085     for (vector<QMCrgUnit *>::iterator itl = lcharges.begin(); itl != lcharges.end(); itl++) {
00086         top->AddAtomisticBeads(*itl, &atop);
00087     }
00088     cout << "Number of charge units in top " << lcharges.size() << endl;
00089     cout << "Number of molecules in atop " << atop.MoleculeCount() << endl;
00090     double crged, neutr;
00091 
00092     MoleculeContainer::iterator imol;
00093     for (imol = atop.Molecules().begin(); imol != atop.Molecules().end(); imol++) {
00094         Molecule *mol = *imol;
00095         QMCrgUnit *crg = mol->getUserData<QMCrgUnit > ();
00096         //Compute the Coulomb sum of the system for a neutral molecule mol
00097         neutr = CalcPot(&atop, mol);
00098         //Change the partial charges of mol to the charged state
00099         top->CopyChargesOccupied(crg, mol);
00100         //Compute the Coulommb sum of the system for mol in a charged state
00101         crged = CalcPot(&atop, mol);
00102         //Copy back the charges as if molecule mol would be neutral so that the loop can pick up the next molecule
00103         top->CopyCharges(crg, mol);
00104         //If the site energy is large and positive (crged >> neutr) molecule mol wants to stay neutral
00105         //This is consistent with marcus_rates.h since w_12 (from 1 to 2) contains (dG_12 + \lambda)^2 and dG_12=e_2-e_1
00106         //Attention not to overwrite the site energies from list_charges.xml
00107         crg->setDouble("energy_coulomb",crged - neutr);
00108         //cout << "Estatic energy [eV] for charged / neutral / crg-neutr=espilon: " << crged << " " << neutr << " " << crged - neutr << "\n";
00109         cout << "Ecoulomb for crgunit " << crg->getId() << " at pos " << crg->GetCom() << " is " << crged - neutr << " eV\n";
00110     }   
00111     atop.Cleanup();
00112     return true;
00113 }
00114 
00115 // Couloumb interactions (sum over all pairs) 
00116 double Ecoulomb::CalcPot(Topology *atop, Molecule *mol) 
00117 {
00118     //estatic energy including contributions from all other molecules in eV
00119     double pot = 0.0;
00120     //Coulomb constant including conversion factors (elementary charge and nm). Resulting potential is in eV
00121     double k_c = 1.602176487e-19 / (1.0e-9 * 8.854187817e-12 * 4.0 * M_PI);
00122     //Do loop over all other molecules imol that are not mol
00123     MoleculeContainer::iterator imol;
00124     for (imol = atop->Molecules().begin(); imol != atop->Molecules().end(); imol++) {
00125         if (*imol == mol) continue;
00126         // periodic boundary-corrected distance between the ceneters of mass
00127         // used for the distance-dependent screening (we should replace getUserData by a funtion GetCom for molecules)
00128         vec bcs = atop->BCShortestConnection(mol->getUserData<CrgUnit > ()->GetCom(), (*imol)->getUserData<CrgUnit > ()->GetCom());
00129         //cutoff check
00130         if (_has_cutoff){
00131 
00132         vec dist = (*imol)->getUserData<CrgUnit > ()->GetCom() - mol->getUserData<CrgUnit > ()->GetCom();
00133       
00134         if ( abs(dist)> _ecoulomb_cutoff) continue;
00135         vec diff = bcs - dist;
00136 
00137         for (int i = 0; i < mol->BeadCount(); i++)
00138             for (int j = 0; j != (*imol)->BeadCount(); j++) {
00139                 Bead *bi = mol->getBead(i);
00140                 Bead *bj = (*imol)->getBead(j);
00141                 // distance between two charges taking into account periodic boundary conditions
00142                 vec r_v = bi->getPos()-(bj->getPos() + diff);
00143                 pot += k_c * bi->getQ() * bj->getQ() / ( (this->*_estatic_method)(abs(bcs)) * abs(r_v) ); //in eV
00144             }
00145         }
00146         //if no cutoff is specified use the whole box
00147         else {
00148             vec dist = (*imol)->getUserData<CrgUnit > ()->GetCom() - mol->getUserData<CrgUnit > ()->GetCom();
00149             vec diff = bcs - dist;
00150 
00151         for (int i = 0; i < mol->BeadCount(); i++)
00152             for (int j = 0; j != (*imol)->BeadCount(); j++) {
00153                 Bead *bi = mol->getBead(i);
00154                 Bead *bj = (*imol)->getBead(j);
00155                 // distance between two charges taking into account periodic boundary conditions
00156                 vec r_v = bi->getPos()-(bj->getPos() + diff);
00157                 pot += k_c * bi->getQ() * bj->getQ() / ( (this->*_estatic_method)(abs(bcs)) * abs(r_v) ); //in eV
00158             }
00159         }
00160     }
00161     return pot;
00162 
00163 }
00164 
00165 double Ecoulomb::dist_dep_eps(const double &dist) {
00166     return _epsilon_dielectric - (_epsilon_dielectric - 1.0) * exp(-_s_eps * dist)*(1.0 + _s_eps * dist + 0.5 * _s_eps * dist * _s_eps * dist);    
00167 }
00168 
00169 double Ecoulomb::constant_epsilon(const double &dist) {
00170     return _epsilon_dielectric;
00171 }
